contentrichtext.text: [[File:Map.Yasato-Town.Ibaraki.PNG|thumb|Map of Yasato, Ibaraki]] {{nihongo|'''Yasato'''|八郷町|Yasato-machi}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Niihari District, Ibaraki|Niihari District]], [[Ibaraki Prefecture|Ibaraki]], [[Japan]]. As of 2003, the town has an estimated [[population]] of 30,218 and a [[population density|density]] of 196.50 persons per km². The total area is 153.78 km². On October 1, 2005 Yasato was merged into the city of [[Ishioka, Ibaraki|Ishioka]]. ==External links== * [http://www.city.ishioka.lg.jp/ Ishioka official website] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Ibaraki Prefecture]] {{Ibaraki-geo-stub}}
